p:
Moreover, the antioxidant activities of these four samples were further determined using different methods at different concentrations. As shown in Figures 3A–F, our results showed that four tested samples exhibited antioxidant activity in a dose-dependent manner within a concentration range of 0.02–0.1 mg/mL. Similar to the standard V
C , over a certain concentration range radical scavenging ability increased before reaching a plateau ( Figures 3A–F). Furthermore, the IC 50 of the four samples of DPPH radicals, hydroxyl radical, reducing power, total antioxidant capacity, hydrogen peroxide and superoxide anion are determined and summarized in Table 4.
